Title.evidence: This randomized trial evaluated whether the PMR was reduced by the use of devices that allow precise localization of the affected margins.

Trial_Design.evidence: Study participants were randomized to receive either SR with radiopaque tissue transfer and X-ray system (KliniTray TM ) or the institutional standard procedure (ISO).

Participants.evidence: Patients with microcalcification-associated breast cancer undergoing planned BCS were enrolled.

Intervention.evidence: Study participants were randomized to receive either SR with radiopaque tissue transfer and X-ray system (KliniTray TM ) or the institutional standard procedure (ISO).

Objective.evidence: This randomized trial evaluated whether the PMR was reduced by the use of devices that allow precise localization of the affected margins.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the PMR.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Study participants were randomized to receive either SR with radiopaque tissue transfer and X-ray system (KliniTray TM ) or the institutional standard procedure (ISO).

Number_Randomised.evidence: Among 122 randomized patients, 5 patients were excluded due to the extent of primary surgery and 117 were available for analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Final histopathology revealed a PMR of 31.7 per cent for the KliniTray TM group and 26.3 per cent for the ISO group ( P = 0.127). Independent factors for positive margins were histological tumour size more than 30 mm (adjusted OR (aOR) 10.73; 95 per cent c.i. 3.14 to 36.75; P < 0.001) and specimen size more than 50 mm (aOR 6.65; 95 per cent c.i. 2.00 to 22.08; P = 0.002).
